title: How to Evolve Chansey into Blissey

steps.title: Level up your Chansey while her friendship level is 160+ (Gen VIII and newer) or 220+ (Gen II to VII).
steps.content: Level up your Chansey while her friendship level is 160+ (Gen VIII and newer) or 220+ (Gen II to VII). After you’ve spent some time bonding with your Chansey (e.g., giving her a Soothe Bell, letting her stay in your active party, etc.), let her level up in battle, or level her up manually with the help of a Rare Candy. At that point, Chansey will evolve into Blissey (the last form of Chansey’s evolutionary line). [1] X Research source Chansey evolves the same way in all Pokémon titles, including recent games like Pokémon Scarlet and Violet . Fun fact: From Gen II to VII, Chansey needed to have a 220 friendship level to evolve into Blissey. In Gen VIII and newer games, this was lowered to 160. You can see if your Chansey is above this threshold by speaking to the friendship rater NPC in your game. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Soothe Bell
steps.content: Soothe Bell Soothe Bells are items that your Pokémon can hold. While held, the Bell helps increase your Pokémon’s friendship levels even more quickly. [3] X Research source In Scarlet and Violet , you can purchase as many Soothe Bells as you’d like from Delibird Presents, or find one for free in Mesagoza. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Luxury Ball
steps.content: Luxury Ball When you’re first catching a Chansey, equip a Luxury Ball rather than a standard Poké Ball. The Luxury Ball gives a small increase to the friendship level of the Pokémon it catches. [5] X Research source Luxury Balls can be bought in game.

steps.title: Putting the Pokémon in your party
steps.content: Putting the Pokémon in your party Add your Chansey to your party (at least for the time being) rather than leaving her in a Box.

steps.title: Preventing the Pokémon from fainting
steps.content: Preventing the Pokémon from fainting When a Pokémon faints in battle, their friendship with you (understandably) goes down. If you end up battling with Chansey, be sure to switch her out before she totally faints.

steps.title: Visiting a Pokémon groomer
steps.content: Visiting a Pokémon groomer Meeting with a Pokémon groomer (sometimes referred to as a “massage lady” or “massage girl”) can help increase your Chansey’s friendship levels. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Leveling Chansey up
steps.content: Leveling Chansey up Leveling Chansey up will provide a boost of up to 5 friendship. You'll get less Friendship for leveling when Chansey has a high Friendship rating. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Giving Vitamins
steps.content: Giving Vitamins These are items that increase Chansey's stats, and each Vitamin will increase Friendship by up to 5. Again, the rewards will diminish as Chansey's Friendship increases. Vitamins include: Protein HP Up Iron Zinc Calcium Carbos PP Up PP Max Rare Candy

steps.title: Offering friendship-boosting berries
steps.content: Offering friendship-boosting berries Try to feed your Chansey berries, like: [8] X Research source Grepa Berry Hondew Berry Kelpsy Berry Pomeg Berry Qualot Berry Tomato Berry

steps.title: Avoiding herbal items
steps.content: Avoiding herbal items Using herbal items during battle will take a massive hit on your friendship level. For example, using a Revival Herb can cost as many as 20 Friendship points, depending on the current Friendship level, while using Heal Powder will cost 5–10 points. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Meet with the friendship rating NPC.
steps.content: Meet with the friendship rating NPC. All games and regions have an NPC that can examine your Chansey and let you know how high your friendship is. Based on the exact quote the friendship rater says, you can have a better idea of when your Chansey is ready to evolve. [10] X Research source From Gen II to VII, Chansey needed to have a 220 friendship level to evolve into Blissey. In Gen VIII and newer games, this was lowered to 160.

steps.title: Let’s Go, Pikachu and Let’s Go, Eevee
steps.content: Let’s Go, Pikachu and Let’s Go, Eevee LGP and LGE are remakes of Pokémon Yellow , a Gen I Pokémon game that was released on Game Boy in 1998. Since Blissey is a Gen II Pokémon that didn’t exist at the time Pokémon Yellow came out, it’s impossible to evolve Chansey in LGP or LGE .

steps.title: All Gen I games
steps.content: All Gen I games The original Pokémon games, like Pokémon Red , Green , Blue , and Yellow only feature the original 151 Pokémon from Gen I. Since Blissey is a Gen II Pokémon, it isn’t possible to evolve Chansey in any of these games.

steps.title: Pokémon LeafGreen and FireRed (until unlocking National Pokédex)
steps.content: Pokémon LeafGreen and FireRed (until unlocking National Pokédex) In FireRed and LeafGreen , it’s not possible to evolve Chansey until you’ve unlocked the National Dex in-game, which is done by: Having 60+ Pokémon in the Kanto Pokédex Traveling to One Island Becoming Pokémon Champion and entering the Hall of Fame Speaking with Professor Oak [11] X Research source
